content.question: Which of the following is equivalent to <math alttext="the integral from, 3 to 5, of x times the natural log of x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the integral from, the natural log of 3, to, the natural log of 5, of, u, d u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>u</mi></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>u</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 3 to 5, of x, d x, times, the integral from, 3 to 5, of, the natural log of x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>⋅</mo><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="one half times x squared, times the natural log of x, evaluated from 3 to 5, minus, the integral from, 3 to 5, of, one half x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><msubsup><mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo>−</mo><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="one half times x squared, times the natural log of x, evaluated from 3 to 5, plus, the integral from, 3 to 5, of, one half x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><msubsup><mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo>+</mo><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="one half times x squared, times the natural log of x, evaluated from 3 to 5, minus, the integral from, 3 to 5, of, one half x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><msubsup><mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msubsup><mo>−</mo><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
